result.execSummary:
The defendant Sherika N. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sherika N. Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sherika N. Brown was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).  
** Pay DNA surcharge.    If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, if any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sherika N. Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Warrant vacated; bond re-instated.  Victim rights compliance; victim spoke at previous hrg.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for three years.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgement.  If revoked, deft requests credit for 2 days.
Email received from defense counsel - deft was in the wrong courtroom - would like to schedule a voluntary appearance

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  No appearance by deft.  Atty DeFilippis held up in Intake Court.  Case was originally scheduled for 10:30am this morning but she could not get a ride to court this morning so hrg was moved to this afternoon @ 2:30pm.  Case called @ 2:48pm.  BW authorized; no bail.
deft unable to get a ride here this morning @ 10:30am; sentencing hrg set over to 2:30pm this afternoon.  Atty DeFilippis notified his client

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody (Taycheedah) w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim present; statement made.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 5/24/16 @ 10:30am

Defendant Sherika N. Brown appeared by video from Taycheedah Correctional with Attorney Rocco DeFilippis.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 3.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 10:10 am.  Jury selection scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Copy of correspondence from DA's office to defense counsel re: discovery

*No Contact w/ Shakheirra C or her residence
943.201(2)9b) - UNAUTHORIZED USE OF AN INDIVIDUAL'S PERSONAL ID INFORMATION OR DOCUMENTS / REPEATER 946.41(1) - Obstructing an officer / Repeater
Return on Warrant.  Writ from Taycheedah.   Canceled warrant with Elma/Gina at 248 p.m.

244pm
  Special Prosecutor Joseph Curi appeared for the state.  Defendant appeared in court in custody and w/ Attorney Rocco DeFilippis.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes: Warrant vacated. Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 4/5/16 @ 830am.  $2500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).   jk
DA requests hearing date for return on warrant. DA to to WRIT for DE.
